titles.title: Utah Recreational Land Exchange Act of 2005
Utah Recreational Land Exchange Act of 2005
Utah Recreational Land Exchange Act of 2006
To authorize the exchange of certain land in Grand and Uintah Counties, Utah, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health.
Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 109-623.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 363.

action.text: Mr. Pearce moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2069.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

bill.summary: 9/27/2006--Passed House amended. Utah Recreational Land Exchange Act of 2006 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to convey specified federal land in Grand, San Juan, and Uintah Counties, Utah, to the State of Utah in exchange for specified non-federal land in such counties. Requires conveyance of the parcels of the federal land and non-federal land in three phases as prescribed by this Act. Requires any conveyance of a parcel of federal land or non-federal land under this Act to include the conveyance of water rights appurtenant to the parcel conveyed. Sets forth provisions regarding: (1) the valuation, appraisals, and equalization of the federal land and non-federal land to be exchanged; and (2) the administration of the non-federal land after the exchange, including mineral revenues, grazing permits, and hazardous materials. Authorizes appropriations.
